info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 22 at 3:37AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Bladen, southeastern Robeson, northwestern Columbus, southeastern Dillon, northwestern Horry and northern Marion Counties through 445 AM EDT... At 337 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Sellers, or near Marion, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Lumberton, Marion, Dillon, Mullins, Elizabethtown, Fairmont, Bladenboro, Latta, Fair Bluff, Lake View, Sellers, Boardman, Blue Brick, Ammon, Hestertown, White Oak, Smiths, Howellsville, Lisbon and Elkton. This includes Interstate 95 in North Carolina between mile markers 5 and 26. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
